results.title: Ghosts of Mars (Collector's edition)
results.creator_credit: Screen Gems, Sandy King and John Carpenter
results.brief_description: In 2176 AD humans have been colonizing and mining the planet Mars for years. It is still a desolate place, a matriarchal society populated by 640,000 colonists and protected by the Mars Police Force (MPF). The film is told in flashback by head strong, drug addicted Lieutenant Melanie Ballard (Natasha Henstridge), who is found hand cuffed to an unmanned train that returns to camp minus its crew. Ballard was part of a MPF troupe enlisted to transfer prisoner James “Desolation” Williams (Ice Cube) from Shining Canyon to Chryse City. When they reach their destination however, Ballard and her fellow crew members: Commander Braddock (Pam Grier), Butler (Jason Statham), Kincaid (Clea DuVall) and Uno (Liam Waite), find the place abandoned and everyone dead, hung upside down and decapitated, a crime with which Williams has been accused in the past but has an alibi for this time. Closer inspection reveals the survival of not only Williams, but also Doctor Arlene Whitlock, 2 other prisoners, and a growing posse of possessed “creatures”, original inhabitants of the planet whose ghosts escaped when Whitlock opened Pandora’s Box. Police and prisoners band together to fight an enemy of Martian spirits against a bleak and blood stained backdrop (shot on location on a gypsum mine near Albuquerque, New Mexico), an industrial soundtrack blasting in the background.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Screen Gems, Sandy King and John Carpenter

results.title: Ghosts of a river
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Pierre Patry and Jacques Kasma
results.brief_description: Looks at the Columbia River as a wild and untamed stream coursing through its beautiful mountain region, sparsely populated but replete with history. Many of the old shot towns and abandoned mines, destined to extinction due to plans for a giant hydro-electric scheme which would transform the whole valley, are shown.

results.title: Ghostbusters (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Bill Murray, Dan Aykroyd and Harold Ramis star as the freelance crusaders who team up as the Ghostbusters Squad. Armed with ectoplasmic swats and patented booby traps, they walk a fine line between scientific genius and lunacy in their quest to rid the city of slimy, haunting monsters on the rampage in New York.

results.title: Ghost world [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Granada Productions, Jersey Shore Films, United Artists Corporation, John Malkovich, Russell Smith, Lianne Halfon and Terry Zwigoff
results.brief_description: Terry Zwigoff followed up the unexpected success of “Crumb” (a startlingly heart-felt documentary on American comic book artist Robert Crumb) with “Ghost world” an adaptation of the popular comic novel by Daniel Clowes. Addressing the vagaries of suburban dysfunction, two misanthropic best friends graduate from High School, eager to explore new possibilities. Initially this equates to hanging out in dreadful 1950s retro diners, reading the personals and mocking the entire world. For Enid (Thora Birch), her identity is closely bound with aesthetics - her constantly changing outfits reflect her turmoil and eternal dissatisfaction. Becky (Scarlett Johansson), more conventionally pretty and able to attract male attention, has a singular goal - to move out with Enid into their own flat. But Enid, uncertain where her desires lie, defers making decisions, frustrating and isolating Becky. After initially humiliating avid record collector Seymour (Steve Buscemi) Enid is drawn to his eclectic interests and, recognising a kindred spirit, determines to find him a girlfriend. Unrelenting deadpan delivery confirms the melancholic tone of the film but dilutes the emotional content contained within a wry and savvy script. Whilst the characters’ physical surrounds are well captured (with some sumptuously shot interiors), the emotional core that drives Enid, and especially Becky is not. Ultimately “Ghost world” is a bittersweet comedy about transition and a journey toward the responsibilities, dilemmas and disappointments of adulthood.

results.title: Ghost of the Spanish Warrior
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “A World of Festivals”.
The Moors and Christians festival of Alicoy in Alicante, Spain celebrates the defeat of the Moors by Christians after 500 years of occupation which left an indelible mark on Spanish culture and architecture. Led by a boy representing St. George, the town’s patron saint, groups of ‘crusaders’ stage a symbolic battle against the ‘moors’.

results.title: Ghost of the Amoco Cadiz
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
In 40 years three major maritime casualties have changed the way ships are worked. The ghost of the biggest accident, the Amoco Cadiz, haunts the shipping industry, and a great deal of research work has been stimulated by the events of that fateful day.
